result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean B Sepstead

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cash bond of $150.00 moved to Case No. 2016CM759 per Court's direction.
Sentencing hearing on March 30, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Cases 16CM7, 16CM61, and 16CM759 called together.  Defendant Sean B Sepstead in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 1 of 16CM61, and count 1 of 16CM759, all other counts are dismissed and read in, including both counts of 16CM7.  Court accepts the pleas, finding them to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their pleas.  Parties select date for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Held off the record. Defendant Sean B Sepstead in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests date for plea and sentencing. No objection from State to schedule off the record.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sean B Sepstead in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads not guilty. Atty Mcclendon requests an adjournment to review new charges issued to defendant.   Further proceedings scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

conditions:   Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants; no violent contact with family members or anyone; no contact with any establishment whose purpose is to sell alcohol.

Defendant Sean Sepstead appears by video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Jamie McClendon. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests $150 cash bail with conditions. Court sets bail.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
